name: Pipeline Based CI instead of manually managed jobs
description: Pipeline Based CI This involves automating the continuous integration process, where code changes are automatically tested and integrated into the main codebase, ensuring consistent and reliable builds. There is a repo with some useful util methods people can start using in bitbucket: 1spatial_jenkins_pipeline_utils

name: Use automation handles consistently across codebases
description: Use Automation Handles Consistently Across Codebases - This practice ensures that automation tools and scripts are used uniformly across different projects, enhancing maintainability and reducing errors.

name: Nexus as a Single Repository
description: Nexus as a Single Repository: Nexus is used as a central repository to manage and store build artifacts, dependencies, and other components, simplifying dependency management and version control.Unify the .NET, Java , Docker and test data artefact storage all in Nexus - single  and backed up source of truth

name: Containarised Test Databases
description: Containerised Test Databases: Using containerized databases for testing allows for isolated, reproducible, and scalable test environments, improving the reliability of tests.Explore the use of Testcontainers for lightweight local and ci database testing : https://java.testcontainers.org/modules/databases/

name: AI Assisted Development
description: Leveraging AI tools, such as GitHub Copilot, to assist in coding can enhance productivity and code quality by providing intelligent code suggestions and automating repetitive tasks.

name: Adopt CD approach for development and test environments
description: Adopt CD Approach for Development and Test Environments: Continuous Deployment (CD) involves automatically deploying code changes to development and test environments, ensuring that the latest code is always available for testing and feedback.Explore ArgoCD

name: Performance Profiling
description: This technique involves analyzing the performance of applications to identify bottlenecks and optimize resource usage, ensuring efficient and responsive software.Investigate tools for performance profiling of code and trial during performance investigations

name: Handling True 3D
description: Handling True 3D: Techniques for managing true 3D graphics involve using specialized algorithms and tools to render and manipulate three-dimensional objects in applications.

name: Handling True Geodetics
description: Handling True Geodetics: This involves accurately representing and manipulating geographic data, taking into account the Earth’s shape and size, for applications like mapping and navigation.

name: Unify approach for Accessibility Testing
description: Unify Approach for Accessibility Testing: Standardizing accessibility testing practices ensures that all applications are tested for compliance with accessibility standards, improving usability for all users.

name: Shared modules for test automation
description: Creating reusable test automation modules allows for consistent and efficient testing across different projects, reducing duplication of effort.

name: Aspect Oriented Programming
description: AOP is a programming paradigm that separates cross-cutting concerns (like logging and security) from the main business logic, improving code modularity and maintainability.

name: Telemetry for app feature usage
description: Collecting telemetry data on how users interact with app features helps in understanding usage patterns and improving the user experience.

name: Enhance Test Integration with Jira
description: Integrating test management tools with Jira allows for better tracking of test cases, defects, and overall project progress.

name: In-house Penetration Testing
description: Conducting penetration tests internally helps identify and address security vulnerabilities before they can be exploited by malicious actors.Assess how do we aquire the skills
column6: tooling and environments to perform in-house penetration ( delta ) testing. Official Pen testing will always be outsourced but as part of Secure by Design principles we should asses our internal capability"

name: Secure by Design Approach
description: This approach involves incorporating security considerations into the design and development process from the outset, rather than as an afterthought.Asses if we can embed the Secure by Design framework of practices for our current and future development : https://www.security.gov.uk/guidance/secure-by-design/principles/

name: Favour lightweight/microservices architecture
description: Adopting a microservices architecture involves breaking down applications into smaller, independent services, which can improve scalability and maintainability.Potentially think about service-event bus , service meshes

name: Think 'bare bones' build infrastucture and build up
description: Starting with a minimal build infrastructure and gradually adding necessary components helps in creating a lean and efficient build process.
column6: where feasible should be self-contained along with all prerequisites set up using IoC principles

name: Docker as main test and release
description: Using Docker for testing and releasing applications ensures consistency across different environments, as Docker containers encapsulate all dependencies and configurations.

name: Windows 11
description: The latest version of Microsoft’s operating system, offering new features, improved performance, and enhanced security.Windows 11 will be our target Windows Desktop platform for development and testing

name: Kubernetes
description: Adopt K8S for deployment of our systems and orchestration - goes hand in hand with microservices architectures and dockerised releases.

name: ELK stack ( Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana)
description: The ELK Stack consists of Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana. Elasticsearch is a search and analytics engine, Logstash is a server-side data processing pipeline that ingests data from multiple sources, and Kibana is a visualization tool that works on top of Elasticsearch1.

name: .NET 8
description: NET 8 is the latest version of the .NET framework, a free, cross-platform, open-source developer platform for building many different types of applications. It includes improvements in performance, new APIs, and enhanced support for cloud-native applications.

name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot is an open-source Java-based framework used to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring-based applications. It simplifies the development process by providing a range of non-functional features commonly used in large-scale projects.

name: Python 3
description: Python 3 is the latest major version of the Python programming language, known for its readability and simplicity. It includes many improvements over Python 2, such as better Unicode support and more consistent syntax.

name: Redis
description: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store used as a database, cache, and message broker. It supports various data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, and more.

name: Postgres Long transactions
description: PostgreSQL, often referred to as Postgres, is an open-source relational database management system. Long transactions in Postgres refer to transactions that run for an extended period, which can impact performance and require careful management to avoid issues like transaction ID wraparound.

name: Java 21
description: Java 21 is a future release of the Java programming language, expected to include new features and enhancements to improve performance, security, and developer productivity.

name: NoSQL
description: NoSQL databases are designed to handle large volumes of data that do not fit well into traditional relational databases. They are often used for big data and real-time web applications, offering flexible schemas and horizontal scalability.

name: SQLServer 2022
description: SQL Server 2022 is the latest version of Microsoft’s relational database management system, offering several key enhancement such as Azure Integration, performance enhancements and hybrid capabilities bi-directional high availability and DR between on-prem SQL Server and Azure SQL Managed instance

name: Oracle 23 Multitenant Platform
description: Oracle 23 introduces enhanced multitenancy features, allowing multiple pluggable databases to run under a single container database. This architecture improves resource utilization and simplifies database management.

name: Non-Azure Cloud Platforms
description: These include cloud services from providers like AWS, Google Cloud, IBM Cloud, and others, offering a range of services similar to Azure but with different features and pricing models.

name: Kafka
description: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform capable of handling trillions of events a day. It is used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications."

name: Serverless Databases
description: These databases automatically scale with the workload and do not require manual management of the underlying infrastructure. Examples include AWS Aurora Serverless and Google Cloud Firestore."

name: Apache Spark
description: An open-source unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing, with built-in modules for streaming, SQL, machine learning, and graph processing.

name: Tauri
description: A framework for building tiny, fast binaries for all major desktop platforms. It uses Rust for the backend and any frontend framework for the UI.

name: W3C Accessibility Insights for Web
description: A tool that helps developers find and fix accessibility issues in web applications, ensuring compliance with W3C accessibility standards.

name: clang
description: A compiler for the C, C++, and Objective-C programming languages, part of the LLVM project, known for its fast compilation and useful error messages.

name: Grafana
description: An open-source platform for monitoring and observability, allowing users to query, visualize, alert on, and understand their metrics no matter where they are stored.

name: Visual Studio 2022
description: The latest version of Microsoft’s integrated development environment (IDE), offering advanced debugging, code completion, and collaboration features.

name: Swig Doc Generator
description: A tool used to generate documentation from source code, often used in conjunction with the Simplified Wrapper and Interface Generator (SWIG).

name: Jmeter
description: An open-source tool designed to load test functional behavior and measure performance. It is primarily used for web applications.

name: Jenkins Pipelines
description: Jenkins Pipelines is A suite of plugins that supports implementing and integrating continuous delivery pipelines into Jenkins, allowing for automation of build, test, and deployment processes.

name: Snyk
description: Snyk A security platform designed to help developers find and fix vulnerabilities in their code, dependencies, containers, and infrastructure as code.

name: OWASP Dependency-Check
description: OWASP Dependency-Check A software composition analysis tool that identifies project dependencies and checks if there are any known, publicly disclosed vulnerabilities.

name: Cypress/Webdriver IO
description: Cypress/Webdriver IO Both are end-to-end testing frameworks for web applications. Cypress is known for its developer-friendly features, while Webdriver IO is a versatile automation framework.

name: Tensorflow Lite
description: TensorFlow Lite A lightweight version of TensorFlow designed for mobile and embedded devices, enabling on-device machine learning.

name: Firebase Analytics/Crashalytics
description: Firebase Analytics/Crashlytics Firebase Analytics provides insights into app usage and user engagement, while Crashlytics helps track, prioritize, and fix stability issues in real-time.

name: Rook/Ceph
description: Rook/Ceph Rook is an open-source cloud-native storage orchestrator for Kubernetes, and Ceph is a distributed storage system that provides object, block, and file storage.

name: Blackbox exporter
description: Blackbox Exporter A Prometheus exporter for blackbox probing of endpoints over HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, TCP, ICMP, and gRPC.

name: C' family coverage tools
description: C’ Family Coverage Tools Tools used to measure code coverage for C, C++, and other languages in the C family, helping ensure that tests cover all parts of the code.

name: Chaos
description: Chaos Chaos engineering involves experimenting on a system to build confidence in its ability to withstand turbulent conditions in production.

name: RustRover
description: RustRover An IDE for Rust development, providing features like smart code completion, refactoring, and debugging.

name: CLion
description: CLion A cross-platform IDE for C and C++ development from JetBrains, offering features like code analysis, refactoring, and debugging.

name: Pulumi
description: Pulumi An infrastructure as code tool that allows developers to use programming languages like TypeScript, Python, and Go to define and manage cloud infrastructure.

name: Terraform
description: Terraform An open-source infrastructure as code software tool created by HashiCorp, enabling users to define and provision data center infrastructure using a high-level configuration language.

name: Bicep
description: Bicep A domain-specific language (DSL) for deploying Azure resources declaratively, providing a simpler syntax compared to ARM templates.

name: WebAssembly
description: WebAssembly A binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine, designed to be a portable compilation target for high-level languages like C, C++, and Rust, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.

name: AzureDevOps for .NET development
description: Azure DevOps for .NET Development A suite of development tools provided by Microsoft for managing the entire application lifecycle, including planning, developing, delivering, and operating .NET applications.

name: Deck.gl (Vis.gl)
description: Deck.gl (Vis.gl) A WebGL-powered framework for visual exploratory data analysis of large datasets, often used in conjunction with Mapbox GL.

name: React 18
description: React 18 The latest version of the popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces, introducing concurrent rendering and other performance improvements.

name: Junit 5
description: JUnit 5 The latest version of the JUnit testing framework for Java, offering a modular architecture and new features to write and run tests.

name: Angular 17
description: Angular 17 The latest version of the Angular framework for building web applications, featuring improvements in performance, developer experience, and new features.

name: MapStore ( react extensions )
description: MapStore (React Extensions) An open-source framework to create, manage, and share maps and dashboards, with extensions for React to enhance its capabilities.

name: Vite
description: Vite A build tool that aims to provide a faster and leaner development experience for modern web projects, leveraging native ES modules.

name: ESRI SDK ( JavaScript , .NET )
description: ESRI SDK (JavaScript, .NET) Software development kits provided by ESRI for building mapping and spatial analysis applications using JavaScript and .NET.

name: OpenTelemetry
description: OpenTelemetry An observability framework for cloud-native software, providing APIs and instrumentation to collect metrics, logs, and traces.

name: .NET MAUI
description: .NET MAUI .NET Multi-platform App UI, a framework for building cross-platform applications for iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows with a single codebase.

name: C# 11-12
description: C# 11-12 The latest versions of the C# programming language, introducing new features and improvements to enhance developer productivity and code quality.

name: Go
description: Go An open-source programming language designed by Google, known for its simplicity, efficiency, and strong concurrency support.

name: .NET Aspire
description: .NET Aspire A hypothetical or future version of the .NET platform, potentially including new features and enhancements for modern application development.

name: Rust
description: Modern and highly popular in the industry alternative to C/C++. Explore for low level, memory hungry, concurency applications. Originally intended to serve as a safer alternative to C and C++, Rust is a systems programming language that has gained significant popularity among developers thanks to its emphasis on safety, performance, and productivity. Our top contender for CoG !!! https://www.rust-lang.org/

name: Compose Multiplatform
description: Multiplatform Application Development - Build your user interface once, and use it on all platforms â€“ Android, iOS, web, and desktop. https://www.jetbrains.com/lp/compose-multiplatform/.Explore together with Kotlin for Multiplatform

name: Flutter
description: Flutter is an open source framework by Google for building beautiful, natively compiled, multi-platform applications from a single codebase.https://flutter.dev/

name: Playwright
description: Playwright is an open-source automation library for browser testing and web scraping.https://playwright.dev/

name: Blazor
description: Blazor is a framework that allows you to use the power of .NET and C# to build full stack web apps without writing a line of JavaScript.https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/apps/aspnet/web-apps/blazor

name: NextJS
description: Increasingly gaining popularity Next.js enables you to create full-stack web applications by extending the latest React features, and integrating powerful Rust-based JavaScript tooling for the fastest builds.https://nextjs.org/

name: Angular 18
description: The Beta version of Angular 17 is now released with plently of new features as well as support for TypeScript 4.7 Support and new APIs. Read more on https://blog.angular.io/.

name: Serverless functions
description: Assess how can we do serverless functions in a platform agnostic way - a serverless function that doesn't have a direct dependency (in its code or in its configuration) to the framework of a particular cloud provider.Explore tools such as Spring Cloud or Kubeless ?

name: React 19
description: The Beta version of React 19 has now been release plenty of useful features ! Keep an eye on the official versions . Blog with quick overview of the changes : https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/new-react-19-features/

name: Cesium
description: Open platform for software applications designed to unleash the power of 3D data.https://cesium.com/. Explore together with CesiumJS (https://cesium.com/platform/cesiumjs/)

name: Micronaut
description: Micronaut is a is an open source JVM-based framework for building lightweight microservices. It is designed to avoid reflection, thus reducing memory consumption and improving start times.https://micronaut.io/

name: Quarkus
description: K8S native Java stack https://quarkus.io/

name: Kotlin for Multi-platform development
description: The Kotlin Multiplatform technology is designed to simplify the development of cross-platform projects. When starting new Cross-platform projects consider Kotlin https://kotlinlang.org/docs/multiplatform.html

name: iOS
description: macOS is the operating system developed by Apple for its Mac computers.Consider for cross-platform development.

name: macOS
description: iOS is Apple’s mobile operating system for iPhone and iPad.Consider for cross-platform development.
